thread.title: HTC U Ultra makes its way to Canada
thread.title_full: HTC U Ultra makes its way to Canada

author: Mitja Rutnik
title: HTC U Ultra makes its way to Canada
text:
Back in January, HTC took the wraps off the U Ultra . The company started accepting pre-orders for the device right away in the US, which started shipping to customers two weeks ago. Now, the smartphone has made its way to Canada as well and you can already purchase it for $999 from HTC’s official online store.
The U Ultra is unlocked and available in three different colors: Sapphire Blue, Ice White and Brilliant Black. HTC is also offering a discount on the JBL Reflect Aware C earphones. The USB Type-C earphones, which normally retail for $269.99, are available with or without a U Ultra purchase, for just $135.
The HTC U Ultra is a large device, as it features a primary 5.7-inch Quad HD display. It is also equipped with a secondary 2-inch screen with a resolution of 160 x 1040 pixels, which is located above the main one. It offers the same kind of capabilities as that found on the LG V10 and V20.
See also: HTC’s unexpected surprise is… a U Ultra version covered in sapphire 23 hours ago The HTC U Ultra is powered by the Snapdragon 821 chipset and has 4 GB of RAM. There’s 64 GB of space available for your apps, images, and other data that can be expanded for an additional 256 GB. The phablet sports a 12 MP camera with an f/1.8 aperture as well as a selfie snapper that has a 16 MP sensor.
Other features worth mentioning are a non-removable 3,000 mAh battery, a fingerprint scanner located on the front and Android 7.0 Nougat with HTC’s Sense user interface on top.
If you’re in the market for a large device, the HTC U Ultra might be up your alley. To get it, visit HTC’s website by clicking the button below.
Get the HTC U Ultra
